column4: i cannot get GRUB installed from the Ubuntu install. (re-installed/tried about 8 times now, kinda pissed) Everything else works out just fine but not it. IS THERE AN ALTERNATIVE WAY (like putting it to a floppy [how?] ) OF GETTING GRUB TO WORK??
please don't take your frustration out on strangers you're asking for help from
I'd assume your cd is busted until you check and show otherwise
umm. ok. Is GRUB Legacy same as GRUB?

well it's on GNU org's pages. They only list GRUB Legacy and GRUB2. and the legacy is only available as a test download.. Where to get GRUB the regular version? (i mean, you probably know how to build a boot floppy with it)
if you have a question, ask it in the channel
please name one virus in the wild that has affected users in the past 5 years
url to media coverage of it affecting users?
sorry, but i am really, really really, REALLY FUCKING PISSED here.
that's awesome, but don't take it out on us
go and have a cup of tea or go for a walk or something
have you verified the cd yet?
then go do that before whinging
whee bob, i got the right md5 summed iso now :) but i have to wait for about 10 hours before i can get it burned; my win XP doesn't let me burn anything.. ("power convert error" or something")
